trans-unit.source: Service Fabric offers two high-level frameworks for building services: the actor framework and the services framework. Understanding the value of each will help you make the right architectural decisions for your application.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric offers two high-level frameworks for building services: the actor framework and the services framework. Understanding the value of each will help you make the right architectural decisions for your application.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric offers two high-level frameworks for building services: the Reliable Actors APIs and the Reliable Services APIs.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric offers two high-level frameworks for building services: the Reliable Actors APIs and the Reliable Services APIs.

trans-unit.source: While both are built on the same Service Fabric core, they make different tradeoffs between simplicity and flexibility in terms of concurrency, partitioning, and communication.
trans-unit.target: While both are built on the same Service Fabric core, they make different tradeoffs between simplicity and flexibility in terms of concurrency, partitioning, and communication.

trans-unit.source: It is useful to understand both models so that you can choose the appropriate framework for a particular service within your application.
trans-unit.target: It is useful to understand both models so that you can choose the appropriate framework for a particular service within your application.

trans-unit.source: Your problem space involves many small independent units of state and logic
trans-unit.target: Your problem space involves many small independent units of state and logic

trans-unit.source: You need to maintain logic across multiple components
trans-unit.target: You need to maintain logic across multiple components

trans-unit.source: You want to work with single-threaded objects while still being able to scale and maintain consistency
trans-unit.target: You want to work with single-threaded objects while still being able to scale and maintain consistency

trans-unit.source: You want to use reliable collections (like .NET Dictionary and Queue) to store and manage your state
trans-unit.target: You want to use reliable collections (like .NET Dictionary and Queue) to store and manage your state

trans-unit.source: You want the framework to manage the concurrency and granularity of state
trans-unit.target: You want the framework to manage the concurrency and granularity of state

trans-unit.source: You want to control the granularity and concurrency of your state
trans-unit.target: You want to control the granularity and concurrency of your state

trans-unit.source: You want the platform to manage communication for you
trans-unit.target: You want the platform to manage communication for you

trans-unit.source: You want to manage the communication and control the partitioning scheme for your service
trans-unit.target: You want to manage the communication and control the partitioning scheme for your service

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that it is perfectly reasonable to use different frameworks for different services within your app.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that it is perfectly reasonable to use different frameworks for different services within your app.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you might have a stateful service that aggregates data generated by a number of actors.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you might have a stateful service that aggregates data generated by a number of actors.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about the Reliable Actors APIs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about the Reliable Actors APIs</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about the Reliable Services APIs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about the Reliable Services APIs</linkText><title></title>
